content:
If you can receive emails in Thunderbird but can’t send them from your Spectrum account, the issue is almost always tied to the SMTP configuration. Spectrum’s outgoing mail settings are quite specific, so even a small mismatch can prevent sending.

Here’s what to double-check:

SMTP Server – mail.twc.com or the server address provided by Spectrum for your region.

Port – Use 587 with STARTTLS (or TLS) encryption.

Authentication – Make sure “Use same username and password as incoming” is enabled.

Username Format – Sometimes Spectrum requires the full email address as the username (e.g., you@example.com).

ISP Restrictions – If you’re on a different internet provider’s network, Spectrum may block outgoing mail unless you’re using authentication with the correct port and encryption.

I remember reading a troubleshooting article on Universal Magzines online about Spectrum’s email setup in Thunderbird, and it highlighted that re-entering credentials in the SMTP section (not just the incoming section) often resolves this issue.

Once the SMTP settings are updated correctly, sending should work without any further tweaks.
